head.title: A Missile Defense Strategy That Will Have to Wait

hedline.hl1: A Missile Defense Strategy That Will Have to Wait

block.p: President Clinton left to his successor the decision on whether to deploy a national missile defense system. He said he would not do so himself because of test failures and diplomatic disputes. The president, speaking at Georgetown University, said he had decided not to act after two huge $100 million tests of the system failed to intercept incoming missiles.

President Clinton left to his successor the decision on whether to deploy a national missile defense system. He said he would not do so himself because of test failures and diplomatic disputes. The president, speaking at Georgetown University, said he had decided not to act after two huge $100 million tests of the system failed to intercept incoming missiles.

Mr. Clinton said more time is also needed to find a diplomatic solution to what has been a growing confrontation between the United States and Russia and China, staunch opponents to an American missile defense.
